original_title: Professionals to hold decisive meeting regarding trade union action
original_body_lines: COLOMBO (News 1st); The Professionals Trade Union Collective is due to hold a decisive meeting on Monday (03).
The Professionals Trade Union Collective said trade unions, civil organizations, and student unions representing various factions will join the discussion.
The meeting is being held to discuss future trade union action based on several issues including the government's tax policy and the proposed Anti-Terrorism Act.
The discussion is being held against a backdrop in which the professionals are yet to receive an opportunity to hold discussions with the President.
The spokesperson of the Government Medical Officer's Association (GMOA) Dr. Chamil Wijesinghe said the meeting will be held at 3 pm on Monday (03).
Spokesperson of the Federation of University Teachers' Associations (FUTA) Charudaththa Ilangasinghe said the strike launched by university teachers is ongoing.
Meanwhile, the University Grants Commission (UGC) said a concerning situation has arisen as a result of university teachers leaving the country.
UGC Chairman Senior Professor Sampath Amaratunga said new university teachers and professors will be recruited after receiving approval from the Treasury.
